item.title: 亚洲股市开局不一，波动性减弱：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市周一开盘涨跌不一，交易商在经历了八月的震荡开局后，将焦点转向了本周公布的关键美国数据。【原文：Asian stocks were poised for a mixed open on Monday as traders shifted focus to key US data prints this week after a volatile start to August.】

item.title: 降息前景黯淡，菲律宾比索情绪高涨
item.description: 菲律宾比索将延续涨势，因为通胀意外回升抑制了本周降息的可能性。【原文：The Philippine peso is set to extend gains after an unexpected pickup in inflation damped the possibility of a an interest-rate cut this week.】

item.title: 套利交易爆炸困扰着因急速平仓而受到冲击的市场
item.description: 现在看来，上周一的全球市场崩溃更像是一次短暂的震荡，是日本央行政策小幅调整和美国经济衰退担忧重现引发的短暂恐慌。【原文：By now, last Monday’s global market meltdown looks more like a brief tremor, a fleeting panic unleashed by a small policy shift from the Bank of Japan and resurgent fears of a US recession.】

item.description:

item.title: 债券在多年辜负投资者之后重新成为避险工具
item.description: 格雷格-阿贝拉（Gregg Abella）是新泽西州的一名基金经理，他没有想到在过去的一周里，他接到了大量客户的电话。"突然有人对我们说，'哇，你认为现在是我们增加债券的好时机吗？【原文：Gregg Abella, a money manager in New Jersey, wasn’t expecting the flood of phone calls he got from clients this past week. “Suddenly people are saying to us, ‘Wow, do you think it’s a good time for us to add bonds?”】

item.title: 官方称降雨充沛，伊拉克小麦产量增长 21
item.description: 一位官员说，伊拉克今年的小麦产量达到 630 万吨，年增长率近 21%，标志着伊拉克第二年实现了粮食自给自足。【原文：Iraq’s wheat output hit 6.3 million tons this year, an almost 21% annual increase that marked a second year of self-sufficiency in the grain, an official said.】

item.title: 巴西飞机失事的飞行和语音数据被提取出来进行调查
item.description: 一名政府航空官员说，在调查人员调查造成机上人员全部遇难的事故原因时，从一架在巴西坠毁的飞机上提取的飞行和语音数据盒 "100%成功"。【原文：Flight and voice data boxes from a plane that crashed in Brazil have been extracted with “100% success,” a government aviation official said, as investigators probe the cause of an accident that killed everyone on board.】

item.title: 美国炼油企业放缓，引发全球原油供应过剩担忧
item.description: 本季度，美国一些顶级炼油厂正在缩减其设施的运营，这加剧了人们对全球原油供应过剩正在形成的担忧。【原文：Some of the top US oil refiners are throttling back operations at their facilities this quarter, adding to concerns that a global glut of crude is forming.】

item.title: 赞比亚关闭与刚果的边境，阻断重要的铜贸易路线
item.description: 赞比亚政府周末表示，赞比亚已暂时关闭了与刚果民主共和国的边境，此举可能会推迟非洲最大铜生产国的出口。【原文：Zambia has temporarily shut its borders with the Democratic Republic of Congo, the government said at the weekend, in a move that could delay exports from Africa’s biggest copper producer.】

item.title: 面对伊朗袭击风险，以色列加强基础设施防御
item.description: 市长们准备好了电池支持的警报器，急救人员有了卫星电话，如果人们需要进入避难所，老式晶体管收音机可以成为信息生命线。【原文：Mayors have battery-backed sirens ready, first-responders got satellite phones and old-fashioned transistor radios could be an information lifeline if people need to move into shelters.】

item.title: 交易员押注剧烈波动，CPI数据将考验市场
item.description: 华尔街这个令人难以忘怀的夏天正接近高潮，所有人都在关注本周的消费者物价报告，交易员们希望这份报告将为美联储在 9 月份的下次会议上开始降息提供所需的弹药。【原文：Wall Street’s summer to forget is approaching its climax, with all eyes on this week’s consumer prices report, which traders hope will give the Federal Reserve the ammunition it needs to begin cutting interest rates at its next meeting in September.】

item.title: 沙特改革投资法以吸引外资
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯宣布了旨在提高透明度和简化在沙特投资流程的新商业法规，以吸引更多外国资本支持经济多样化。【原文：Saudi Arabia announced new business regulations aimed at boosting transparency and easing the process of investing in the kingdom as it looks to attract more foreign capital to support economic diversification.】

item.title: 金属成本飙升后，奥运金牌比以往更值钱了
item.description: 在今年的巴黎奥运会上，奥运金牌比以往任何时候都更值钱，每块金牌的原材料都有可能卖到约 900 美元。【原文：Olympic gold medals are worth more than ever at this year’s Paris games, with the raw materials that go into them having the potential to fetch about $900 each.】

item.title: 伊朗新总统在内阁选举中任命石油部长
item.description: 据半官方的伊朗学生通讯社报道，前国营伊朗国家石油公司副董事长穆赫森-帕克内贾德（Mohsen Paknejad）已被任命为伊朗新任石油部长。【原文：Mohsen Paknejad, a former deputy in the state-run National Iranian Oil Co., has been named as Iran’s new oil minister, the semi-official Iranian Students’ News Agency reported.】

item.title: 阿达尼集团称最新的兴登堡指控是 "恶意 "的
item.description: 阿达尼集团在一份交易所文件中称，Hindenburg 的最新指控是对公开信息的恶意、恶作剧和操纵性选择。【原文：The latest allegations by Hindenburg are malicious, mischievous and manipulative selections of publicly available information, the Adani Group says in an exchange filing.】

item.title: 迪士尼计划推出反派主题乐园和新船，大力发展度假区
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司（Walt Disney Co.）推出了一系列新的主题公园景点，包括其首个电影反派乐园，以及位于加利福尼亚州的复仇者联盟乐园（Avengers Campus）扩建一倍，作为其度假区业务广泛扩张的一部分。【原文：Walt Disney Co. unveiled a slew of new theme-park attractions, including its first land devoted to movie villains and a doubling of its Avengers Campus in California, as part of an extensive expansion of its resorts business.】

item.title: 哈里斯支持取消小费税，采纳特朗普提出的建议
item.description: 副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）表示，她将寻求终止对服务业工人的小费收入征税；她的2024年竞选对手共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）也提出了同样的建议，以争取年轻人和工薪阶层选民的支持。【原文：Vice President Kamala Harris said she would seek to end taxes on tipped income for service industry workers — matching a proposal that her 2024 rival Republican Donald Trump has also made in a bid to court young people and working-class voters.】

item.title: 日本 6 万亿美元股市惨遭抛售一扫而空
item.description: 日本股市在 8 月份创下了创纪录的三日跌幅，市值减少了 1.1 万亿美元。对于看涨的投资者来说，这为购买 2024 年最热门的交易之一提供了新的理由。【原文：Japanese equities shed $1.1 trillion in value as they kicked off August with a record three-day loss. For bullish investors, that’s providing a fresh reason to buy what has been one of 2024’s hottest trades.】

item.title: 哈里斯表示她不会干涉美联储，以此抨击特朗普
item.description: 副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）表示，她将尊重美联储的独立性，试图与她在2024年的共和党竞争对手唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）形成对比，她计划在未来一周推出她的经济议程内容。【原文：Vice President Kamala Harris said she would respect the Federal Reserve’s independence, seeking to draw a contrast with her 2024 Republican rival Donald Trump, and that she plans to roll out elements of her economic agenda in the coming week.】

item.title: 兴登堡公司指控印度监管机构主席与阿达尼公司有冲突
item.description: 兴登堡研究公司（Hindenburg Research）指责印度市场监管机构主席存在利益冲突，这家总部位于美国的公司称这妨碍了对阿达尼集团操纵和欺诈指控的彻底调查。印度证券交易委员会主席玛达比-普里-布赫强烈否认了这一指控。【原文：Hindenburg Research accused the chair of India’s market regulator of conflicts of interest that the US-based firm said prevented a thorough examination of allegations of manipulation and fraud at the Adani Group. The chair of the Securities and Exchange Board of India, Madhabi Puri Buch, strongly denied the allegations.】

item.title: 美国通胀小幅回升不会阻碍美联储 9 月降息
item.description: 美国 7 月份的通胀可能略有回升，但不足以使美联储放弃普遍预期的下月降息。【原文：US inflation probably picked up modestly in July, but not enough to derail the Federal Reserve from a widely anticipated interest-rate cut next month.】

item.title: 私人信贷希望提高贷款利润率：信贷周刊
item.description: 过去一周全球市场的动荡让私人信贷基金开始质疑，他们是否应该重新考虑日益紧缩的贷款利润率要求。【原文：The turmoil in global markets this past week is causing private credit funds to question whether they should reconsider the ever-tighter loan margins they’re demanding.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼认为存在通胀上行风险，对缩表发出谨慎信号
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）表示，她仍然认为通胀存在上行风险，劳动力市场也将继续保持强劲，这表明她可能还没有准备好在 9 月份美国央行行长下次会议上支持降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said she still sees upside risks for inflation and continued strength in the labor market, signaling she may not be ready to support an interest-rate decrease when US central bankers next meet in September.】

item.title: 华尔街周良好的经济与过热的交易员
item.description:
市场的剧烈波动刺激了有关美联储紧急降息的讨论，但市场的混乱掩盖了美国经济的潜在 实力。【原文：

item.title: 美国科技巨头之外的盈利增长终现端倪
item.description: 随着美国企业的又一个季度财报季进入最后冲刺阶段，有一点是显而易见的：那些被人工智能狂潮遗忘的公司，期待已久的复苏终于开始了。【原文：As another quarterly earnings season from Corporate America enters its final stretch, this much is clear: The long-awaited recovery in the companies that were left out of the artificial-intelligence frenzy has finally begun.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯在钢铁业未来之争中出售钢铁厂股份
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯股份公司（Thyssenkrupp AG）的钢铁部门计划出售德国一家工业基地的股份，此前该部门的监事会会议结束，但未就更广泛的重组达成一致。【原文：Thyssenkrupp AG’s steel unit plans to sell a stake in an industrial site in Germany after a supervisory board meeting ended without agreement on a broader restructuring of the ailing division.】

item.title: 财政部长要求印度银行在资金紧张时增加存款
item.description: 随着家庭储蓄日益转向投资产品，印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）呼吁贷款机构专注于核心业务，并探索吸引存款的新方法。【原文：Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman called on lenders to focus on their core business and explore new ways to attract deposits, as household savings increasingly shift toward investment products.】
